definition: to entertain/to repay/to return/to reward/to compensate/to reply/to answer
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline

sentences.english: For executives, it is common to have longer-term rewards such as stock options.
sentences.chinese: 對於主管們，長期的酬謝包括認股權。

sentences.english: And if ye lend to them of whom ye hope to receive, what thank have ye?
sentences.chinese: 你們若借給人，指望從他收回，有什麼可酬謝的呢。

sentences.english: They rewarded me with a prize.
sentences.chinese: 他們給我一筆獎金作酬謝。

sentences.english: She gave me buy a bike in return for my help.
sentences.chinese: 她給我買了一輛自行車以酬謝我的幫忙。

sentences.english: As a reward, the man who lost the money gave the boy $3.
sentences.chinese: 那位丟錢的男士給了那個男孩3美元作爲酬謝。

sentences.english: The travelers recompensed the man who so carefully directed them .
sentences.chinese: 旅遊者們酬謝那位認真地爲他們導遊的人。

sentences.english: This is a reward for services rendered.
sentences.chinese: 這是酬謝所提供服務的獎金。

sentences.english: Dr. Swift took her presents but never gave the boy anything for his trouble.
sentences.chinese: 斯威夫特博士接受她的禮物，但從不給小廝任何酬謝。

sentences.english: I reward him with 50 dollars for taking me to the station.
sentences.chinese: 他把我帶到車站，我付給他50美元以表酬謝。

sentences.english: The last time I found a lady's purse, she didn't have any change for a reward.
sentences.chinese: 上次我撿到一位女士的錢包，她沒有零錢酬謝。

sentences.english: Why should they be thanked with sub-bribery for their duty?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼還要用次級賄賂來酬謝他們呢？

sentences.english: The guest compensated a waiter for his cheerful willing service.
sentences.chinese: 客人酬謝了服務員熱情周到的接待。

sentences.english: Afterward I asked if it was appropriate to reward her graciousness.
sentences.chinese: 拍完之後，我還問了對她的好心表示酬謝是否合適。

sentences.english: If there is any way you can send me my address book, I would be willing to pay for it.
sentences.chinese: 要是你肯把郵箱通訊錄還給我，我願意酬謝你。

sentences.english: The firm repaid her hard work with bonus.
sentences.chinese: 公司發給她獎金以酬謝她工作努力。

definition: poe divination, a traditional Chinese divination method where a pair of crescent-shaped wooden or bamboo blocks is thrown on the ground, with the positions of the blocks determining the divine answer
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
head of a society/sponsor of an organization
abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest
to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
(of a supernatural or divine being) to appear/to make itself manifest
